greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, where T(n,k) equals the number of permutations of {1..n+1} with [(nk+k)/2] inversions for n>=k>=0.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = A008302(n+1, [(nk+k)/2]) = coefficient of q^[(nk+k)/2] in the q-factorial of n+1 for n>=0.
maple: b:= proc(u, o) option remember; expand(`if`(u+o=0, 1,
seq(seq(T(n,k), k=0..n), n=0..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, May 02 2017
mathematica: Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 06 2019, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 12 2007
